data.title: About Netenrich
data.meta_description: Meet the Netenrich leadership team, Security Experts, and Security Advisory Council. Transform your digital operations with Resolution Intelligence Cloud.
data.text:
JUDY HATCHETT

VICE PRESIDENT & CISO

Judy Hatchett is the VP and chief information security officer at Surescripts. She sets the vision, develops plans, and oversees the execution of Surescripts' enterprise information and physical security, business continuity, and enterprise risk management programs to ensure comprehensive, high-quality, and effective risk and information security management in support of business goals. With 20 years in cybersecurity, she has held leadership roles overseeing global teams for governance, cybersecurity, HIPAA compliance, and identity management in multiple critical industry verticals (manufacturing, retail, and healthcare).

Judy is currently the president of the Women in Cyber Security (WiCyS) MN affiliate, an DirectTrust commissioner, DirectTrust criteria council chair, and an active advisory board member. She earned her bachelor’s degree in organizational studies from Bethel University and holds a Masters in Security Technologies from the University of Minnesota School of Science.

RAMY HOUSSAINI

FOUNDER, TECHNOLOGIST, AND BOARD MEMBER

With a unique background in cybersecurity, data privacy, operational risk management, and technology, Ramy has global experience in financial services, consumer goods, telecom, and healthcare. He is an active member of several industry boards and forums with a focus on operational resilience, data privacy and cybersecurity. Ramy is a global cyber resilience executive and the Group Data Protection Officer for BNP Paribas as well as a member of the firm’s RISK executive board. In addition, Ramy is the founding chair and cyber happiness officer of the Cyber Poverty Line Institute, an organization with the mission of acting as a cyber capability multiplier to empower individuals, organizations, and societies with the knowledge and tooling needed to achieve digital equality and cyber inclusion.

Prior to his current role, Ramy served as vice president of British Telecom in Europe, regional head of the cyber practice for Accenture, and vice president for global risk management at Visa Inc. He is an active member of several industry boards and forums with a focus on operational resilience, data privacy, and cybersecurity. Ramy is a member of the G7 Cyber Expert Group and serves on the risk and compliance committee of the board of a California-based healthcare company as well as the advisory board of several start-ups focusing on optimizing operational risks.

JOY RANDELS

ENTREPRENEUR, CEO, AND SPEAKER

Joy launched the first of 14 ventures at age 17. Nine successful acquisitions and two IPOs later, she exercises her passion for building high-value, scalable businesses as the founder and chairwoman of New Market Partners, where she has helped launch and fund 96 companies. Joy’s most recent venture, The Prowess Group, assists founders in building valuable companies. She has worked with over 1,000 founders to amplify their leadership, build scalable businesses, transform valuations, and experience highly successful exits.

Having successfully climbed the corporate ladder and achieved entrepreneurial success, she claimed her seat on public and private boards of directors. She has proven she can win at the VC game, establishing her own fund and serving as a limited partner in three prominent venture funds.

Joy has led public and private companies from bootstrap through venture and IPO, raising over $360M in capital and generating more than $15B in revenue. She has played key roles in the design and development of software and professional service offerings for 20 years with the foremost companies in the world. As a C-level executive, her experience extends to industry leaders Apple, Akamai, and CA Technologies, where she was responsible for over $2B in revenue per year and 17 acquisitions. Joy has also founded and successfully exited businesses in the supply chain, logistics, professional, and business service industries.

TONY COLE

CEO, STRATEGIC ADVISOR, AND LEADER

A global business leader, trusted strategic advisor, leading expert in digital and cybersecurity risk oversight, Tony has served as CEO, CTO, CISO, board member, advisor, author, and speaker, and has contributed to the growth of some of the biggest brands and government agencies. He started his career as an Army cryptographer and cybersecurity operator. In his final military role, he chartered the Pentagon CIRT.

Tony is a former chief technology officer of Attivo Networks, a cybersecurity company where he led strategy and vision for the company leading to an acquisition by publicly traded SentinelOne in May 2022. Tony has worked on cyber and digital systemic risk issues with organizations such as the G20, Bank for International Settlements (BIS), World Economic Forum (WEF), Financial Stability Board (FSB), Munich Security Conference, and many others.

Tony served as a member-at-large of the NASA Advisory Council under appointment by the NASA Administrator. He also served on the National Security Telecommunications Advisory Committee’s IoT security subcommittee under appointment by President Obama, and on the FCC Communications Security, Reliability, and Interoperability Council (CSRIC-V) under appointment by the FCC chairman. Tony was the global government CTO at FireEye/Mandiant, working with governments and critical infrastructure around the globe. His consultative risk and cybersecurity advisory efforts led to significant corporate growth, helping usher FireEye through an IPO and multiple acquisitions.

MICHAEL S. OBERLAENDER

CISO, CSO, AUTHOR, AND SME

Michael has a broad, global, diversified background in various industries and markets, more than 35 years of technology and security leadership experience, and a strong focus on security strategy. Michael is a globally recognized thought leader (quoted in Wall Street Journal, Computer World, Security Magazine, CSO Online, and many others), multi-book author (C(I)SO – And Now What? and Global CISO – Strategy, Tactics, & Leadership – How to Succeed in InfoSec and CyberSecurity), publisher, and has written numerous articles for leading security magazines. He has also been a frequent speaker, panelist, and moderator at security conferences.

Michael holds a Master of Science in Physics from the Ivy League-ranking University of Heidelberg, Germany. He is a dual citizen (U.S. and EU) and multi-lingual. He is also a member of (ISC)², ISACA, ISSA, and InfraGard (FBI), and has served on multiple boards and advisory boards in the security industry. He is certified with a dozen of the most leading security certifications of the industry. Michael has defined and built the security organizations, programs, strategies, and overall technology roadmaps for several global players and enterprises. He is a sought-after leader and subject matter expert.

PAUL INNELLA

CEO – TDI

With 30 years of cybersecurity and computer science experience, Paul has founded, financed and built TDI, a world-class cybersecurity consulting firm that has protected and defended government agencies and commercial clients. He grew TDI year after year to be a multimillion dollar, consistently profitable company servicing hundreds of clients. Secured, negotiated, and ensured execution on hundreds of contracts with end customers, government agencies, and strategic partners.

An active writer, blogger, and speaker, Paul is a leading cybersecurity expert who regular conducts seminars and talks on cybersecurity. He is a recognized corporate executive who has published articles and conducted interviews (Financial Times, Forbes, ABC News, FOX News, Federal News Radio, MSN, EuroNews, ComputerWeekly, Washington Business Journal, CSO, SC Magazine) and delivered seminars and lectures to a worldwide audience. Paul is also employed as a subject matter expert on and technical advisor to commercial companies, global universities, and U.S. government agencies.
